data.title: Twelve UND alums to compete for Lord Stanley’s Cup
data.meta_description: A total of twelve alums from the North Dakota hockey program will be competing for Lord Stanley's Cup beginning on May 15, when the Stanley Cup Playoffs begin. UND
data.text:
Stanley Cup Playoffs begin May 15; UND aims for eighth winner in last 12 seasons

GRAND FORKS, N.D. – A total of twelve alums from the North Dakota hockey program will be competing for Lord Stanley's Cup beginning on May 15, when the Stanley Cup Playoffs begin. UND will have at least one former player on the ice or behind the bench in seven of the eight series to begin play.

Following a 56-game regular season, the top four teams in each division have advanced to the first round of the playoffs. The No. 1 and 4 seeds will battle as well as the No. 2 and 3 before the winners of each round will play each other in the second round.

After the second round of inter-divisional play has ended, the remaining teams of the North (Toronto, Edmonton, Winnipeg and Montreal) and East (Pittsburgh, Washington, Boston and New York Islanders) divisions will square off as well as the Central (Carolina, Florida, Tampa Bay and Nashville) and West (Colorado, Vegas, Minnesota and St. Louis) will play in the newly-named semifinal round. The final teams standing will vie for the Stanley Cup.

Eighteen different UND products have hoisted Lord Stanley's Cup, most recently T.J. Oshie and Shane Gersich in 2018 with the Capitals. UND has had a player on a Stanley Cup-winning team in seven of the last 11 seasons.

UND ALUMS IN THE 2021 STANLEY CUP PLAYOFFS

North Division:

(2) Edmonton Oilers: Head Coach Dave Tippett

(3) Winnipeg Jets: Defensemen Derek Forbort and Tucker Poolman

East Division:

(2) Washington Capitals: Forward T.J. Oshie

(4) New York Islanders: Forwards Brock Nelson and Travis Zajac

Central Division:

(2) Florida Panthers: Defenseman Matt Kiersted

(4) Nashville Predators: Forward Rocco Grimaldi

West Division:

(1) Colorado Avalanche: Forward Tyson Jost

(3) Minnesota Wild: Forwards Zach Parise and Luke Johnson

(4) St. Louis Blues: Forward Austin Poganski

UND ALUMS ON STANLEY CUP-WINNING TEAMS

Year Player Team

1983-84 Gord Sherven Edmonton Oilers

1985-86 Craig Ludwig Montreal Canadiens

1989-90 Geoff Smith Edmonton Oilers

1990-91 Jay Caufield Pittsburgh Penguins

1991-92 Jay Caufield Pittsburgh Penguins

1995-96 Troy Murray Colorado Avalanche

1998-99 Ed Belfour Dallas Stars

1998-99 Tony Hrkac Dallas Stars

1998-99 Craig Ludwig Dallas Stars

1998-99 Rick Wilson (AC) Dallas Stars

1999-00 Brad Bombardir New Jersey Devils

2005-06 Mike Commodore Carolina Hurricanes

2009-10 Jonathan Toews Chicago Blackhawks

2011-12 Matt Greene Los Angeles Kings

2012-13 Jonathan Toews Chicago Blackhawks

2013-14 Matt Greene Los Angeles Kings

2014-15 Jonathan Toews Chicago Blackhawks

2016-17 Carter Rowney Pittsburgh Penguins

2017-18 Shane Gersich Washington Capitals

2017-18 T.J. Oshie Washington Capitals

For more news on UND hockey, visit FightingHawks.com. Follow on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram @UNDmhockey.
